verses.text: 愚蒙人當轉向智慧智慧建造自己的房屋，鑿成七根柱子。

words.note: Refers to those lacking wisdom, often easily misled.
Personification of Wisdom, common in Proverbs.
Often used for long, slender objects.

verses.text: 它宰殺牲口，調配美酒，擺設筵席。

words.note: Refers to the personified Wisdom.
Specifically for mixing drinks or ingredients.

verses.text: 它差派幾個使女出去，自己又在城裡的高處呼喊：

words.note: Formal term for sending, often in a mission context.
Common term for female servants in biblical/ancient texts.

verses.text: 「誰是愚蒙人，可以到這裡來！」又對無知的人說：
「你們都來，吃我的餅，喝我調配的酒。

words.note: Here, '調配' functions adjectivally to describe the wine.

verses.text: 愚蒙人哪！你們要丟棄愚蒙，就可以存活，並且要走在智慧的道路上。」

words.note: Refers to the naive or inexperienced, often lacking moral understanding in Proverbs.
Figuratively, a way of life or conduct.

verses.text: 糾正好譏笑人的，必自招恥辱；責備惡人的，必遭受羞辱。

words.note: Pronounced hào (4th tone) when meaning 'fond of', not hǎo (3rd tone).
Often used in literary or more formal contexts.

verses.text: 你不要責備好譏笑人的，免得他恨你；要責備智慧人，他必愛你。
教導智慧人，他就越有智慧；指教義人，他就增加學問。

words.note: More formal than 教導, implying guidance or advice.

verses.text: 敬畏耶和華是智慧的開端，認識至聖者就是聰明。

words.note: A profound reverence mixed with awe, particularly towards God.
A title for God, emphasizing His supreme holiness.

verses.text: 因為藉著我，你的日子就必增多，你一生的年歲也必加添。
如果你有智慧，你的智慧必使你得益；如果你譏笑人，你就必獨自擔當一切後果。
愚昧的婦人喧嘩不停，她是愚蒙，一無所知。
她坐在自己的家門口，坐在城中高處的座位上，
向過路的人呼叫，就是向往前直行的人呼叫：
「誰是愚蒙人，可以到這裡來！」又對無知的人說：

words.note: Often refers to those lacking wisdom or spiritual discernment in Proverbs.

breakdown.m: in order to, by means of

verses.text: 「偷來的水是甜的，在暗中吃的餅是美味的。」

words.note: Used after a verb to indicate acquisition or direction 'towards'.
Forms an adjectival phrase or nominalizes an adjective.
Forms an adjectival phrase or nominalizes an adjective.

verses.text: 人卻不知道她那裡有陰魂，她的客人是在陰間的深處。

words.note: Refers to the spirits of the dead in a spiritual context.
The realm of the dead; often refers to Sheol in the Old Testament.
